Question: Should patients with RA on DMARDs who are NOT at target receive IA corticosteroids alone or add/switch DMARDs or IA corticosteroids and add/switch DMARD(s)?

Explanations.a: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation concealment, lack of blinding, and selective reporting.
Explanations.b: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. Study compared IA GCs + csDMARD to csDMARDs.
Explanations.c: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and value suggesting harm. Very small sample size.
Explanations.d: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Very small sample size.
Explanations.e: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Very small sample size and low number of events.
Explanations.f: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting no effect. Very small sample size.

References.1: Menon Nea. Comparison of Intra-articular Glucocorticoid Injections with DMARDs versus DMARDs alone in Rheumatoid Arthritis. Journal of the association of physicians of india. 2014;62:673-6.
